author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Madras High Court Bench here on Wednesday refused to stay the ongoing process for recruiting 333 pharmacists for various primary health centres across the State through the Medical Services Recruitment Board.

However, the court ordered that the appointments would be subject to the result of a writ petition filed by an aspirant who had challenged the system of giving weightage to candidates with better qualifications without following employment exchange seniority.
title: TAMIL NADU
